conbody.p: This topic describes the Screen Driver Graphics test suite and explains how to set up the test environment.

section.title: Test approach
section.p: The purpose of the test suite is to test specific functionality of the display, such as the display mode and display orientation. The tests are automated and do not require user intervention.

section.title: Automated test cases
section.p: The following is the basic test structure:
Display Modes used: EColor16MA, EColor64K and EColor16MU (in different hardware devices, using different display modes).
Orientation Modes used: EOrientationNormal
Draw Modes used: EDrawModePEN, EDrawModeNOTPEN, EDrawModeAND, EDrawModeOR, EDrawModeNOTSCREEN and EDrawModeXOR.

section.title: Test environment and execution
section.p: The test execution is controlled from the test PC and tests can be run on target environments, such as a hardware reference board.
A typical regression test environment consists of:

li.p: A PC with the Symbian platform source code, binaries and test source code. In addition, specific test execution tools and configuration scripts are required to run the test and prepare the test environment on the PC. These should all be readily available in the build.

For hardware testing, a prototype phone or reference board (such as H4HRP) must be connected to the PC through a serial cable for debug purpose. The base ROM image is built on the PC and transferred to the hardware by flashing the device or using an MMC card.

section.p: There is no remote side test environment and the tests are not dependant on any external equipment.
For details, refer to Building and execution.

section.title: Test results
section.p: When tests have finished executing on the hardware board, results can be found in c:\logs\testexecute on the device. You can copy these files into the MMC or other media and then observe the test results in the HTML files. If using TestDriver to execute, results can be found in %EPOCROOT%\testdriver\results on the PC.

Each test case in the script contains just one test step, which passes or fails. Each test step performs a number of actions on the API. The log displays the percentage of test cases that have passed successfully. The script should have a 100% pass rate.

Each test suite produces its own HTML log file containing the results of the test run. When examining the log file, check the results at the bottom of the log first. This gives a summary of the number of tests in the suite that have passed, failed or panicked. In the body of the log, passing tests are highlighted in green, failing tests in red, while tests which cause a panic are shown in blue.

section.title: Assumptions
section.p: This test suite is based on the following assumptions:

li.p: All the tests are validated on variant handset devices.
All tests are executed on Symbian Test Execute Framework.
All tests are executed on an S60 PP image.
